DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate safety effectiveness injectable slow release preparation naltrexone reduce alcohol consumption risk relapse alcohol-dependent subject . Individuals receive either naltrexone placebo injection total three month , two subsequent followup visit span 6- month period .
DOC.criteria: Meets criteria alcohol dependence . Abstinent alcohol period least 3 day prior begin study . Able read English complete study evaluation . Females postmenopausal , surgical sterilization , use reliable mean birth control . Meets criteria dependence psychoactive substance alcohol nicotine and/or cannabis . Prior history opioid dependence . Regular use psychoactive drug include anxiolytic antidepressant . Prior treatment naltrexone . Current use disulfiram . Psychotic otherwise severely psychiatrically disabled ( e.g. , suicidal , current mania ) . Significant underlying medical condition hepatic , cerebral , renal , thyroid , cardiac disease . Abstinent longer 28 day prior randomization .
